news.title: Illegal water connections found in Rajasthan housing board colony
news.para: Public Health Engineering Department officials found seventy illegal water connections in Ratnagiri Apartment. This discovery is expected to lead to a broader inquiry into unauthorized water usage across Rajasthan Housing Board colonies. Many residents in Indira Gandhi Nagar and Pratap Nagar reportedly have illegal connections. PHED plans a crackdown on these unauthorized links.

news.title: Minister hints at possible third phase of land pooling for Amaravati
news.para: The Andhra Pradesh government will continue its Land Pooling Scheme (LPS) for upcoming capital city projects, with a potential phase-III for an international airport and smart industries. The development plan emphasizes an eco-friendly capital with 30% designated as blue and green zones, featuring extensive recreational facilities and landscaping.

news.title: Upalokayukta orders action against illegal constructions near Srirangapatna
news.para: Karnataka Upalokayukta Justice B Veerappa has ordered revenue officials in Mandya to act against illegal constructions, including Chandravana Ashrama, on encroached government land along the Cauvery riverfront.  These properties, built without mandatory buffer zones and approvals, have even altered the river's course. Officials are directed to demarcate encroachments and initiate action within one month.

news.title: Hyderabad civic body to take over administrative records of merged ULBs
news.para: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) is taking over administrative records from 27 urban local bodies slated for merger. Deputy municipal commissioners are instructed to seize records, close bank accounts, and compile employee and property details. GHMC nameboards will be installed as these areas officially integrate into GHMC limits from December 2.

news.title: Take steps to resolve issue of plots to poor: Minister to Panckula civic body's chief
news.para: Haryana's Urban Local Bodies Minister Vipul Goel has ordered the Panchkula municipal commissioner to expedite the allotment of 100-yard plots to poor families under the Mahatma Gandhi Awas Yojana. He also directed the handover of 24 model houses in Pinjore, built 13 years ago, which are currently vacant and deteriorating.

news.title: Minister promises OC relief for rural properties in Bengaluru
news.para: Bengaluru residents in gram panchayat areas are set to receive relief from the Occupancy Certificate (OC) rule, mirroring exemptions granted within Greater Bengaluru limits. MLAs urged Energy Minister KJ George to extend the waiver, particularly for properties around GBA outskirts, with assurances that the process is underway.

news.title: Tamil Nadu to get satellite imagery to modernize, digitize land records
news.para: Tamil Nadu's Directorate of Survey and Settlement is set to procure high-resolution satellite imagery to digitize land records, aiming to resolve boundary disputes and encroachments faster. This initiative will enhance the TN geographical information system with precise latitude and longitude data, improving land surveying and governance across the state.

news.title: Telangana nets another ₹1,000 crore from Neopolis land auction
news.para: Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA) secured approximately Rs 1,000 crore from the third phase of Neopolis land auctions. This brings HMDA's total earnings from three phases to Rs 3,708 crore. The average pricing for Neopolis auctions now stands at Rs 137.36 crore per acre. This shows a significant increase in market confidence.

news.title: Cheaper fitout costs keep office leasing on growth path
news.para: India's office leasing is breaking records. This is due to lower costs for office rentals and fitouts. Global companies are choosing India to expand. They are creating modern workplaces focused on employee well-being and technology. This trend is expected to continue, boosting the office fitout market. India's affordability and evolving workplace designs are key factors.

news.title: Haryana RERA directs Chintels to refund homebuyer’s money with interest
news.para: Haryana RERA has ordered builder Chintel to refund a buyer Rs 1.7 crore with 10.85% annual interest. The buyer sought a refund after the Chintel Paradiso housing society partially collapsed in February 2022. The authority also awarded Rs 2 lakh for mental agony and Rs 50,000 for litigation costs.

news.title: Builder arrested in ₹23 crore cheating case in Nashik
news.para: A prominent Nashik builder has been arrested for allegedly cheating flat owners of Rs 23 crore. He mortgaged properties for which full payment was made and possession given, without executing sale deeds. The builder then secured a loan against these flats from a financial firm, leading to auction notices for residents.

news.title: JPMorgan Chase leases 1.76 lakh sq ft office space in Hyderabad
news.para: JPMorgan Chase has sub-leased a significant 176,000 sq ft facility in Hyderabad, marking one of the largest financial services deals in the city this year. This expansion underscores the company's growing investment in India's global capability center ecosystem and its commitment to supporting global operations through its Indian hubs.

news.title: Himachal Pradesh RERA amendment bill passed amid opposition walkout
news.para: The Himachal Pradesh assembly has approved an amendment to the Real Estate Act, shifting the role of committee chairperson for RERA member recommendations from the High Court Chief Justice to the Chief Secretary. This move sparked a walkout from opposition members who decried the decision.

news.title: NCLAT says committee of creditors has right to appoint liquidator for debt-ridden firm, not NCLT
news.para: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) affirmed that the power to appoint a liquidator for an insolvent company solely resides with the Committee of Creditors (CoC). This decision overturns previous orders from the NCLT that permitted liquidator appointments without the CoC's approval.

news.title: Illegal khata scam: Citizen’s complaint triggers suspension of six Greater Bengaluru authority personnel
news.para: A citizen's complaint led to the suspension of six Greater Bengaluru Authority (GBA) officials for allegedly creating 128 illegal vacant-land khatas. Investigations revealed that these khatas were issued without valid ownership documents, bypassing mandatory legal checks and violating several acts. The GBA has initiated departmental inquiries and legal proceedings, emphasizing a zero-tolerance policy towards such irregularities.

news.title: Six buildings sealed in Ludhiana’s push against illegal structures
news.para: Ludhiana Municipal Corporation has sealed six buildings for non-compliance with demands for pending dues and rectification of illegal structures. This stern crackdown follows directives from MC Commissioner Aaditya Dachalwal to expedite civic fee recovery and enforce strict measures against unauthorized constructions. Residents are urged to obtain official approval before commencing any construction work.

news.title: Andhra Pradesh government launches phase-II of Amaravati land pooling scheme
news.para: The Andhra Pradesh government has launched the second phase of its Land Pooling Scheme in Amaravati. The CRDA will now acquire over 6,600 acres across seven villages. This move aims to expand the capital city area. The government previously acquired around 33,000 acres in the first phase. This new acquisition will further bolster land holdings for Amaravati's development.
